metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6126 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A precision error in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 67.0.3396.62 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6126` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 60.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
